questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are correct in relation to the ANSI/SPARC architecture?

The logical view is a single description of the data elements and their relationships.
A data definition language is used to define the internal schema.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the relational data model?
options: Values in a tuple of the relation are atomic.
The range of values of an attribute is defined by the degree.

The cardinality of a domain refers to the total number of values in the domain.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to concept of keys in the relational data model?

A key with only one attribute can be selected as the primary key
Both a super key and a key specifies a uniqueness constraint on tuples.

I – referential integrity constraint, II - key constraint, III – entity integrity constraint.
I – entity integrity constraint, II – key constraint, III – domain constraint.
I – entity integrity constraint, II – key constraint, III – none of the relational model constraints.
I – key constraint, II – entity integrity constraint, III – none of the relational model constraints.
answer: I – entity integrity constraint, II – key constraint, III – domain constraint.

For any tuple in R1, value of A1 occurs as a value of the primary key field in some tuple in R2.

questions.question: Database security and authorization subsystems use Discretionary security mechanism. Which of the following statements is/are true on Discretionary security mechanism?
options: Granting and revoking privileges are the usual methods of enforcing a Discretionary security mechanism.
A Discretionary security mechanism is a collection of decision support technologies, aimed at enabling the knowledge worker to make better and faster decisions.
Discretionary security mechanisms have two levels for assigning privileges to use the database system as account level and relational level.
Discretionary security mechanism govern the access to the information by the individuals on the basis of the classification of subjects and objects in the system.
Discretionary security mechanism governs the access of users to the information using a set of predefined discretionary rules and user’s identity.
answer: Granting and revoking privileges are the usual methods of enforcing a Discretionary security mechanism.
Discretionary security mechanisms have two levels for assigning privileges to use the database system as account level and relational level.
Discretionary security mechanism governs the access of users to the information using a set of predefined discretionary rules and user’s identity.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are incorrect regarding End-users and practitioners of a Database?

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are true regarding database languages?
options: DDL allows the user to describe any associated integrity and security constraints.
DML provides basic insert, delete, and update operations on data held in the database.
Procedural DML allows users to state what data is needed rather than how it is to be retrieved.
Non-Procedural DML allows users to tell the system exactly how to manipulate data.

answer: DDL allows the user to describe any associated integrity and security constraints.
DML provides basic insert, delete, and update operations on data held in the database.

questions.question: Logical and physical data independence are two important concepts used to ensure data independence in Database Management Systems. Which of the following is/are true regarding these two concepts?
options: Physical data independence refers to the ability to change the conceptual schema without changing external schemas.
Logical data independence refers to immunity of conceptual schema to changes in the internal schema.

Logical data independence ensures that changes in entities, attributes and their relationships will not affect external schemas.
Physical data independence does not require changes to conceptual or external schemas.
answer: Logical data independence ensures that changes in entities, attributes and their relationships will not affect external schemas.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are true regarding ANSI/SPARC Architecture? I) The conceptual level describes how the data is stored in the database. answer: III only

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are correct about the database design process?

questions.question: Listed in Column A are different types of attributes and in Column B are descriptions associated with a certain type. questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding Views in SQL?

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding the commonly accepted security goals?
options: Database integrity is lost if unauthorized changes are made to the data by either intentional or accidental acts.
Database availability refers to making all data objects available to both authentic and unauthentic users.
Database availability refers to protecting data from unauthorized disclosure.
Database confidentiality refers to the protection of data from unauthorized disclosure.

answer: Database integrity is lost if unauthorized changes are made to the data by either intentional or accidental acts.
Database confidentiality refers to the protection of data from unauthorized disclosure.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding access control in DBMS?
options: The two main approaches to access control are Discretionary and Mandatory Access Control.

CREATE VIEW Head_Funds AS SELECT D.HeadEmpNo, L.Name, SUM(Budget) AS TBudget FROM Research_Fund R, Lecturer L, Department D WHERE D.HeadEmpNo = R.EmpNo AND D.HeadEmpNo = L.EmpNo GROUP BY HeadEmpNo, Name; You will be given the following SQL statements to execute on the ‘Head_Funds’ view created above. I. SELECT * FROM Head_Funds WHERE Name = Silva; II. INSERT INTO Head_Funds VALUES (1,’Fernando’,50000); III. CREATE VIEW Head_Fund1 AS SELECT HeadEmpNo, Name, TBudget FROM Head_Funds WHERE TBudget >30000; Which of the following statements is/are true?
options: Only (I) can be executed on Head_Funds view.
Only (II) can be executed on Head_Funds view.
Only (III) can be executed on Head_Funds view
Only (I) and (II) can be executed on Head_Funds view
Only (II) and (III) can be executed on Head_Funds view
answer: Only (I) can be executed on Head_Funds view.
Only (III) can be executed on Head_Funds view
